alert.note: Alert for Mecklenburg (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 30 at 5:31PM EDT until September 30 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of piedmont North Carolina, including the following county, Mecklenburg. * WHEN...Until 900 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Overflowing poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 528 PM EDT, Automated rain gages across the county were indicating storm totals in excess of 1.5 inches today, and as heavy tropical showers continue to redevelop across the region, flooding of low-lying areas across greater Charlotte will develop. Many of the smaller streams within the city will continue to rise, with a few coming out of their banks. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Uptown Charlotte, Huntersville, Central Charlotte, South Charlotte, Northeast Charlotte, East Charlotte, Southwest Charlotte, Northwest Charlotte, West Concord, Matthews, Cornelius, Mint Hill, Davidson, Pineville, Harrisburg, Tega Cay, Marvin, The Plaza, Hidden Valley and Freedom Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
